Class mutex

boost::sync::mutex

Synopsis

// In header: <boost/sync/mutexes/mutex.hpp>


class mutex {
public:
  // types
  typedef unspecified native_handle_type;

  // construct/copy/destruct
  mutex();
  mutex(mutex const &) = delete;
  mutex & operator=(mutex const &) = delete;
  ~mutex();

  // public member functions
  void lock();
  bool try_lock();
  void unlock() noexcept;
  native_handle_type native_handle() noexcept;
};

Description

mutex public types

  1. typedef unspecified native_handle_type;

    Note

    This type is only available if BOOST_SYNC_DEFINES_MUTEX_NATIVE_HANDLE macro is defined by the library.

mutex public construct/copy/destruct

  1. mutex();
    Default constructor.

    Creates a mutual exclusion primitive in the unlocked state.

    Throws: An exception in case if the operating system is unable to create the primitive (e.g. due to insufficient resources). 

  2. mutex(mutex const &) = delete;
  3. mutex & operator=(mutex const &) = delete;
  4. ~mutex();
    Destructor.

    Destroys the mutual exclusion primitive.

    Requires:

    The primitive is in the unlocked state.

mutex public member functions

  1. void lock();
    Locks the mutex.

    If the mutex is not locked, the method locks it and returns. Otherwise the method blocks until the mutex is unlocked.

    Throws: An exception in case if the operating system is unable to fulfill the request. 

  2. bool try_lock();
    Attempts to lock the mutex.

    If the mutex is not locked, the method locks it and returns true. Otherwise the method returns false.

    Throws: An exception in case if the operating system is unable to fulfill the request. 

  3. void unlock() noexcept;
    Unlocks the mutex.

    Releases the mutex that has been locked by the current thread.

    Requires:

    The mutex is locked by the current thread. 

  4. native_handle_type native_handle() noexcept;
    Returns a handle that represents a native operating system primitive that implements the mutex.
    Note

    This method is only available if BOOST_SYNC_DEFINES_MUTEX_NATIVE_HANDLE macro is defined by the library.
